page.title: 07MUSEUM OF LINCOLNSHIRE LIFE
page.content: The aim of the museum when it was established was to picture the agricultural, industrial and social history of Lincolnshire from Elizabeth I to Elizabeth II. The special importance of the collections is mainly on the 19th and early 20th century. The Lincolnshire Local History Society are hoping to build up the collection with materials from the earlier periods as money becomes available. The importance of the recent years have been mainly items relating agriculture, the most single factor in the history of Lincolnshire and the one which has affected the lives of Lincolnshire people more than any other.
